intro: Sieruela augustinensis, commonly known as the Augustinian sieruela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
